image.altText: Two men in suits talking,.

props.synopsis: Australia and the United States sign a multi-billion-dollar minerals deal as Anthony Albanese heads to the White House for his first in-person meeting with Donald Trump. Follow live.

title.children: Trump inks minerals deal with Albanese and tells Rudd: 'I don't like you'

image.altText: Two men in suits speak.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump lavishes praise on Australia and Anthony Albanese during the pair's landmark meeting in Washington, but takes a swipe at a former prime minister in the room.

title.children: Trump praises Australia, signs rare minerals deal in first official meeting with Albanese

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine turn around to look at Prince Andrew

props.synopsis: Superstar royal biographer Andrew Morton on Prince Andrew, royal scandals and the huge hole Harry and Meghan have left in the monarchy.

title.children: What losing a royal title says about the limits of privilege

image.altText: A physical bank card is being locked up with a lock.

props.synopsis: In recent months, there's been a growing focus on private credit, the alter ego of private equity, and the potential it may have to destabilise the system.

title.children: Could private credit spark the next financial market meltdown?

image.altText: Two men use the backs of their hands to wipe tears from their eyes at a burial for Ahmad Abu Mteir killed in an Israel strike on

props.synopsis: US officials travel to Israel as new strikes threaten to unravel progress towards achieving peace in Gaza.

title.children: US steps up diplomacy as Israeli strikes test Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: Sculpture by the Sea 2025 Bondi

props.synopsis: From record October heat to dangerous thunderstorms and gale force winds, the next 36 hours could bring extreme weather across south-east Australia.

title.children: 36 hours of record heat, winds, storms predicted for south-east Australia

image.altText: A man plays in a sandpit with his four children.

props.synopsis: Homeschooling rates are rising rapidly, with families claiming schools aren't coping with bullying or neurodiversity.

title.children: 'Accidental' homeschooling grows, as families blame struggling schools

image.altText: Sapphire and diamond crown at the centre, matching necklace in the foreground.

props.synopsis: This latest heist at the Louvre highlights the vulnerability of objects in public collections. The irony is they are often gifted to such institutions for safekeeping.

title.children: As this fascinating history of art heists shows, timing is everything

image.altText: A map of Australia with markers and a search field with the words 'your place' inside it.

props.synopsis: Ancient First Nations stories are all around us — if you know where to look.

title.children: Ancient Australia mapped: What Deep Time stories are near you?

image.altText: Close-up of mother breastfeeding baby boy while sitting in living room at home.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers have uncovered how having children and breastfeeding reduces the long-term risk of an aggressive form of breast cancer more commonly seen in younger women.

title.children: Breastfeeding can reduce breast cancer risk. Now researchers understand why

image.altText: A white AWS logo next to the dark silhouettes of people walking past a convention stall.

props.synopsis: Amazon's cloud unit AWS has experienced a major global services outage that also disrupted hundreds of other platforms, including Robinhood, Snapchat, Roblox and Perplexity.

title.children: Amazon cloud unit outage impacts hundreds of platforms

image.altText: Punnets of strawberries on a supermarket shelf, with a customer supply notice underneath

props.synopsis: Queensland strawberry growers are finishing their season early due to hot weather, while cold temperatures have delayed ripening in the south.

title.children: Strawberries hard to come by as weather extremes affect supply

image.altText: Richard Marles close up.

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles says the incident was "unsafe and unprofessional" and the government has made representations to China.

title.children: 'Unprofessional' Chinese fighter jet incident raised with Beijing: Marles

image.altText: A photo of a young woman and a young man.

props.synopsis: Stacey Hatfield's husband revealed the nutritionist and social media influencer died in September after giving birth to the couple's first child.

title.children: Food influencer Stacey Hatfield dies after homebirth complication

image.altText: The Northern Beaches Hospital

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns said the government has reached a $190 million deal to takeover the fledgling hospital.

title.children: $190m deal to put Northern Beaches Hospital in public hands

image.altText: A man in tan suit, glasses, grey hair and beard speaks into mic with supporters wearing 'peter george' t-shirts behind him

props.synopsis: A $100,000 donation from a sole donor was one of 212 declared by anti-salmon campaigner Peter George in his federal politics tilt, newly released Australian Electoral Commission returns show.

title.children: $100k from sole donor helped fund Peter George campaign, AEC returns show

image.altText: A man smiles at a piano in Hamilton

props.synopsis: A country Victorian art gallery has surprised local artist Hamish Elsmann with an exhibition of work he never knew it was keeping. The community response has changed his life.

title.children: A gallery quietly collected his sketches for years. Then they surprised him

image.altText: The casing of a missile on a salt lake bed.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners win a decision against a multinational weapons manufacturer after finding one of the company's missiles at a heritage site in the remote South Australian outback.

title.children: Maker of missile found in outback 'directly linked' to human rights harm

image.altText: A river with green trees growing beside it placed on orange dirt.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners and pastoralists in WA's Pilbara are hoping a government-ordered review into the usage of a significant aquifer will better protect it.

title.children: WA government calls on EPA to investigate water usage in the Pilbara

image.altText: The ChatGPT app icon on a mobile phone screen.

props.synopsis: When Georgina Doll was looking to buy a home, generative artificial intelligence was one of the sources she turned to for advice.

title.children: AI 'often gets figures wrong', financial adviser warns

image.altText: A composite image of three men.

props.synopsis: A convicted "fraudster" has been able to represent vulnerable veterans, scamming them in the process.

title.children: 'Fraudster, con-man, liar': Convicted scammer ripping off vulnerable veterans

image.altText: An athlete smiles on the sidelines while wearing protective American Football gear.

props.synopsis: Police say former Tampa Bay running back Doug Martin died after an attempted detainment following reports of a break-in.

title.children: Former NFL running back Doug Martin dies after struggle with police

image.altText: F1 driver smiling and holding the winner's trophy on the podium

props.synopsis: McLaren boss Andrea Stella says the Formula 1 drivers' championship is still in his team's hands despite Max Verstappen's dominant performance at the US Grand Prix.

title.children: McLaren not panicking about Verstappen's F1 resurgence

image.altText: A checkout stacked with groceries including tomato sauce and shampoo

props.synopsis: Independent wholesale distributors are calling on the federal government to reconsider the $50 million food subsidy scheme for remote stores that rolled out on July 1 of this year.

title.children: Remote food subsidy scheme accused of creating a monopoly

image.altText: Sandstone front gate, people walking in, architectural drawing

props.synopsis: Leo Sayer leads the fight against plans to transform a historic former jail into an upmarket accommodation and hospitality venue in the NSW Southern Highlands.

title.children: Ageing pop star leads fight against plans to redevelop old jail

image.altText: A jockey in checkered racing garb rides a dark horse down a track.

props.synopsis: A 10-time Group 1 winner, So You Think – who claimed back-to-back WS Cox Plate victories – is remembered as one of greatest race horses hit the turf in Australia.

title.children: 'Perfection on four legs': Legendary Cox Plate winner So You Think dies

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground with trees and car in the background

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old has been charged with murder following the suspicious death of a 48-year-old man who disappeared two weeks ago.

title.children: Man charged with murder following Darling Downs man's disappearance

image.altText: Four men stand in front of outback pub

props.synopsis: Northern Territory government backbenchers charge taxpayers thousands of dollars in travel as "assistant ministers", a role not officially recognised by the parliament.

title.children: 'Gammon' assistant minister roles rack up travel costs on public purse

image.altText: Samara Joy performs in a gold dress in front of her 7-piece band with the ornate Carnegie Hall stage wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Samara Joy has been compared to singers like Ella Fitzgerald and Sarah Vaughan. She's performing in Australia for the first time and bringing some new music.

title.children: At just 25, jazz singer Samara Joy is credited with bringing Gen Z to jazz

image.altText: The Colombian flag mid-flutter on a flag pole in winds, seen on a white sky background and in front of a dark glass window

props.synopsis: The Colombian foreign ministry said Daniel García-Peña had returned to Bogotá from Washington DC after Donald Trump also announced the US would slash financial assistance to the country.

title.children: Colombia recalls US ambassador after Trump announces tariffs increase

image.altText: Women stressed in green tops and grey pants lining up on a baseball pitch

props.synopsis: Two West Australians are on the cusp of making history as professional women's baseball returns to the US after a 70-year hiatus.

title.children: WA baseballers in draft for first US pro women's league in 70 years

image.altText: A stone church outbuilding with a school girl in uniform running past

props.synopsis: Australia's first saint faced challenges head-on and paved the way for modern pilgrims from a tiny school in rural South Australia, a nun says.

title.children: Fifteen years on, Australia's first saint is inspiring a new generation

image.altText: An artist impression of a hydrogen power plant with white buildings

props.synopsis: South Australian taxpayers are set to pay more than $250 million on generators for the scrapped hydrogen plant — but the state government says it is in an "excellent position" to recoup the costs.

title.children: SA government hopes generator sales can recoup shelved hydrogen plant costs

image.altText: three kids in red shirts playing in the sprinkler

props.synopsis: A severe heatwave warning is in place for parts of western Queensland with Birdsville poised to tip the record for the hottest October day.

title.children: Outback town to hit record-breaking 46 degrees today in severe heatwave

image.altText: A young man skates at a skate park.

props.synopsis: Outdated and forgotten skate parks in the NT forced skaters to build their own underground spot. After years of neglect, experts ask why a region struggling with youth crime can't maintain one of the simplest crime prevention tools there is.

title.children: Forgotten skate parks leaving Territorians behind
